captures.author: @chiefofautism
captures.text: CLAUDE CODE but for HACKING - its called shannon, you point it at website and it just... tries to break in... fully autonomous with no human needed. i pointed it at a test app and it stole the entire user database, created admin accounts, and bypassed login, all by itself, in 90 minutes
captures.whyInteresting: Autonomous security testing agent - showcases dangerous/useful capability of Claude-based agents

captures.author: @SahilBloom
captures.text: There's an opportunity right now to build a $100k per month side hustle as an AI Concierge. And you don't even have to be *that* technical to do it. Just high agency...
captures.whyInteresting: Business opportunity directly relevant to AI agent services - what Marb is already doing

captures.author: @michael_chomsky
captures.text: I literally 10x'd my prices for SetupClaw, and will be raising them even more soon. Revenue went up significantly when I did
captures.whyInteresting: Real-world pricing validation for AI setup services market

captures.author: @claudeai
captures.text: Introducing Claude Opus 4.6. Our smartest model got an upgrade. Opus 4.6 plans more carefully, sustains agentic tasks for longer, operates reliably in massive codebases, and catches its own mistakes. It's also our first Opus-class model with 1M token context in beta.
captures.whyInteresting: Major Anthropic release - Opus 4.6 with 1M context, better agentic performance

captures.author: @corbtt
captures.text: Feels surreal to me that you can still walk around an office in 2026 and see rows of white-collar workers editing spreadsheets, reading docs, writing memos. This will all be gone in two years, just like the human 'calculators' of the 1940s. Do they know it?
captures.whyInteresting: Kyle Corbitt (Y Combinator) on AI disruption timeline - 2 years to mass displacement

captures.author: @corbin_braun
captures.text: I think any developer that sees what I see is straight up grinding 24/7. we know the walls are collapsing.
captures.whyInteresting: Developer zeitgeist - urgency around AI disruption

captures.author: @MatthewBerman
captures.text: I made @openclaw 10x better. I wish I knew this stuff sooner. I spent the last 2 weeks using it and put together all of the best practices I learned.
captures.whyInteresting: OpenClaw best practices from Matthew Berman - practical tips video

captures.author: @jacalulu
captures.text: Lulubot Takeaways: 1 week of building and using my OpenClaw
captures.whyInteresting: First-week OpenClaw learnings - practical experiences

captures.author: @jumperz
captures.text: discord is lowkey the best infra that many are sleeping on.. ive been running my openclaw swarms there and it just works.. channels, threads, roles, permissions, real-time comms, full history, mobile app
captures.whyInteresting: Discord as multi-agent orchestration layer - interesting infra insight

captures.author: @Ibelick
captures.text: so I built webclaw, a fast, local-first, open-source web client for openclaw. multi-sessions, no accounts, no db.
captures.whyInteresting: Open-source web client for OpenClaw - might be useful tool

captures.author: @emollick
captures.text: The Opus 4.6 system card has some extremely wild stuff that remind you about how weird a technology this is. These paragraphs are really worth reading.
captures.whyInteresting: Ethan Mollick highlighting notable passages from Opus 4.6 system card

captures.author: @VraserX
captures.text: GPT-5 is now proposing experiments, executing them in autonomous labs, learning from the results, and iterating. 36,000+ reactions. 40% cost reduction. This is not software anymore. This is automated scientific progress.
captures.whyInteresting: GPT-5 + Ginkgo autonomous lab loop - AI-driven scientific discovery at scale

captures.author: @TrungTPhan
captures.text: think this demo is what Dario means when he says '50% of entry level white-collar jobs will be gone by 2030'
captures.whyInteresting: Dario Amodei quote context with Opus 4.6 demo - connects AI capability to job impact

captures.author: @tomdale
captures.text: I don't know why this week became the tipping point, but nearly every software engineer I've talked to is experiencing some degree of mental health crisis.
captures.whyInteresting: Industry pulse - developers having mental health crisis this week (Opus 4.6 week)

captures.author: @ryancarson
captures.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. Getting this spun up locally. Will report back.
captures.whyInteresting: Ryan Carson endorsing Bhanu Teja's Mission Control guide for AI agent squads

captures.author: @kalashbuilds
captures.text: i did it again. this time it took me 22 million tokens to build programmatic seo for my startup. i used claude opus 4.6 max. result? 100k pages ranking on google.
captures.whyInteresting: Practical Claude use case - programmatic SEO at scale, 22M tokens for 100k pages

captures.author: @scaling01
captures.text: Opus 4.6 is now better than human experts at reading and interpreting scientific charts
captures.whyInteresting: Opus 4.6 benchmark - superhuman at chart interpretation

captures.author: @plur_daddy
captures.text: There's Not Enough Money In The World - market regime change due to AI capex cycle shortage of financial capital
captures.whyInteresting: Macro analysis of AI capex cycle impact on capital markets

captures.author: @ali_moiz
captures.text: This is surprisingly clear and actionable.
captures.whyInteresting: Ali Moiz (Stonks founder) endorsing 'SaaS is dead, agents killed it' article

captures.author: @RayFernando1337
captures.text: Must run to fix memory issues with your OpenClaw
captures.whyInteresting: OpenClaw memory fix tip - enable memory flush and session memory search

captures.author: @maxbittker
captures.text: racing Opus 4.6 against 4.5 to max out a Runescape account
captures.whyInteresting: Fun AI benchmark - Opus 4.6 vs 4.5 playing Runescape autonomously, highly viral

captures.author: @HungryPawnsX
captures.text: I honestly have no idea if we are close to a crash, a melt up, ww3, an AI industrial revolution, a mother of all short squeezes, a depression, a recession, or aliens. But it sure feels like all of them at once.
captures.whyInteresting: Captures the zeitgeist - maximum uncertainty across all vectors

captures.author: @rationalaussie
captures.text: By the time normal people wake up to what is happening they will be unemployed and on UBI. I think this is all going to happen too fast for most of humanity to have any real say in it. We are on the fast takeoff path.
captures.whyInteresting: Commentary on OpenAI Frontier launch - fast takeoff thesis
